commit_list.message:
Switch to library approach for built in sensor.

Use helium-script 2.x to package and run this by:

semi-hosted: `helium-scipt -m main.lua lps22hb.lua`
upload: `helium-scipt -u -m main.lua lps22hb.lua`

interactive use of the library:

`helium-scipt -i lps22hb.lua`

then you can do:

```
> lps22hb = require("lps22hb")
> sensor = lps22hb:new()
> sensor:read_temperature()
```

commit_list.message:
Change create/update signatures

Resource and metadata creation and updating has changed to no longer take keyword arguments as the "dictionary" for attributes. They now take a attributes keyword argument that is a dictionary of the attributes.

This allows for (1) full string attribute keys and (2) additional arguments to those methods for needed arguments like relationships. See `Label.create` for an example

commit_list.message:
Add aiohttp async support

Note: Using asyncio support requires Python 3.5.  Async support allows
for servers to be written using the helium-python library that can
perform multiple API requests while servicing external requests at the
same time. An example use-case is a service that listens for live sensor
data while streaming it to an external service.

commit_list.message:
Feature/relationships (#1)

Adds relationship functions to enable Resources to declare relationships with other resources. 

The method builders in the `helium.relations` module will inject the right methods in the source and target classes based on the arguments provided. 

This includes writable support which allows, for example, labels to have sensors added and removed to them.

commit_list.message:
Don't pop attributes on resource creation

Since the attribute dictionary can be shared across multiple
instantiation calls we can't pop it during creation since we don't
technically own those attributes.

We leave the relationships pop alone for now since we haven't found a
case where that is shared quite yet.

Add support for COLUMNS to adjust calculated terminal width

output does to fit in the terminal.

With this change we add support for a COLUMNS environment variable

of columns.

commit_list.message:
Updated peerbook behavior

Peerbook will not return stale keys or values, or accept stale peers
on a put.

I also changed the this_peer behavior. The swarm's peer will get sent
out every so often (5 minutes by default). Any changes to data that
affects this peer will not get sent out until that time.

This simplifies the peer heartbeat at the cost of not sending out peer
changes as soon as they happen.

commit_list.message:
This should make versioning part of the commits

The Arduino library setup requires the library.properties file to
contain the current version. So we can't auto-generate that file, it
has to be checked into the repo.

make version VERSION=<version> will update library.properties, tag the
repo and push it which in turn will kick the release process on travis.

ip4/ip6 address is used.
